content: f r e e bobbi garter stitch jacket knitting pattern in bobble peep dk gauge it is essential to work to the stated gauge in order to achieve your desired fabric and garment size you should always start by knitting a gauge square before knitting the full garment if you have fewer stitches than stated you will need to go down needle sizes until the correct gauge is achieved if you have more stitches you will need to go up needle sizes please check individual patterns for gauge before starting your garment finishing we recommend using mattress stitch for seaming your garment when sewing in the sleeve you will need to fold the sleeve in half and while matching the fold to the shoulder seam sew in position between the markers once your garment is complete it is essential to block your knitting pin your garment out to the size stated in the pattern cover with a damp cloth and leave to dry ddkk 4mm us6 gauge 112 122 50g 10cm/4″sq metres yards ball 22 sts 52% wool/wolle/lana/laine/ull/villa 48% nylon/polyamid/poliamida/polyamide/polyamid/polyamidi 3 swor 82 bobbi garter stitch jacket knitting pattern in bobble peep dk abbreviations * repeat the instructions following the single asterisk as directed work instructions within brackets as many times as directed work instructions within brackets for a specific size beg beginning cm centimetres cont continue g-st garter stitch every row knit g grams in inch es increase increase ing k knit kfb knit into front and back of stitch 1 st made k2tog knit 2 together mm millimetres 52% falkland wool 48% nylon rem remain ing 4mm repeat repeat us6 rh right hand rs right side st s stitch es decrease together reshape whilst damp do not tumble dry ws wrong side bobbi garter stitch jacket level yarn west yorkshire spinners bobble peep dk equipment teddy bear 165 08 one pair of 3 25mm uk10/us3 knitting needles one pair of 4mm uk8/us6 knitting needles stitch holders teddy bear 165 four hinged stitch markers 3 3 3 4 4 4 x 50g 2 2 2 3 3 3 buttons gauge measurements 21 sts and 42 row to 10cm measured over garter stitch using 4mm needles or size needed to fit to achieve stated gauge it is essential to work to the stated gauge months 0 6 6 9 9 12 12 18 18 24 24 36 to ensure success to fit chest cm 36 41 46 51 56 61 in 14 16 18 20 22 24 actual size cm 46 52 56 62 66 71 in 18 20½ 22 24½ 26 28 full length approximately cm 21 25 29 33 35 38 sleeve length cm 12 15 17 20 24 29 4 left front right front using 3 25mm needles cast on 22 25 27 30 32 35 sts using 3 25mm needles cast on 22 25 27 30 32 35 sts row 1 rs side edge k to end row 1 rs neck edge k to end row
